text: Poured from a bottle over in Sydney. Nice golden colour, very carbonated, head fades. Strangely, Im not getting much in the way of aroma - a little bit of custardy sweetness but thats about it. Taste is straight away white grape, sauvignon blanc, hay. Comes on very bitter but not overwhelming. This really is a mashup of beer and wine, and the results are great. Very drinkable beer, while being interesting, too. Worth the $21 price tag... just.

Golden straw color, white head. Plastic and phenols at first, but luckily the aromas disappeared quickly. Floral nose, apple, grape juice, yeast, basement, light malty. Malty taste, sweet, earthy, grapes, grass, alcohol. Medium body, soft carbonation.

Bottle 0,5l. Pours a golden colour and leaves no head and almost no lacing. Aroma of sauvignon blanc. Taste of sauvignon blanc, grapefruit and malts. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
I am a sucker for anything sauvin. Nice grapefruit aroma more so than the typical passionfruit. Great bags of citrus grapefruit with a balanced bitter finish. Not too over the top despite the 8% abv
Bottle. Golden color, hazy to cloudy liquid, white head. Blend of wine and beer, which slightly resembles saison. Dry wine in aroma. Medium bitter taste. Not very good experiment.

Bottle at Punakaiki Beach Hostel. Pours a clear golden with a white head. Sweet with a light dryness. Fruity aromas of sweet grapes and pale malts. Medium to light bodied. Medium to high carbonation. Long and quite bitter finish with hints of honey.
Sample from the bottle at Olutexpo 2016, Helsinki. Colour is clear light orange with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Fruits, grain and malts.

Bottle @ Olutexpo 2016. 
Poured clear golden color with a thin white head. 
Peachy, sour, fruity aroma. 
Flavor has lemony notes, peach, sweetness, tartness. Complex, fruity. Orange finish.

Bottle @ OlutExpo 2016. Pours yellowish orange with a smooth. Aroma of juicy fruits, zesty grapefruit, lemon and citrus. Taste is sweetish, fruity and zesty with some grapefruit and lemon. Finish is sweet, zesty lemony and citrusy with some fruits and soda like notes. A bit artificial fruity.

750ml bottle from International Beer Store, Perth. Pours a hazy golden with a white head that quickly dissipates. Aromas of tropical fruits and gooseberries, with a full body and high carbonation. A seamless blend of wine and beer, with an bitter finish to balance the richness and the 8.5% is well hidden. Excellent hybrid,
650ml bottle. Pours a crisp gold with no head. Nose has hops and wine notes. Similar taste which has a champagne feel to it.

650ml bottle. Aroma is a sauvignon blanc with grass, gooseberry and a little sweaty note. Taste is huge juicy gooseberry. Its tart, big grape and it hides the underlying pilsner well. Delicious, but the chateau aro is definitely the best of the series (though this is much more affordable).
Very grassy and pungent sauvignon gooseberry smell. Taste is the same delicious taste. Not overly pilsnery. More refreshing and enjoyable. Very close to its namesake inspiration.

BOTTLE. Hazy light straw with minimal white head.. Peach and honey on the nose with a touch of grass tones.. Clean crisp palate, honey & fruit hops with a touch of lemon acidic bitterness.. Sourced Cape Cellars

650ml bottle.
Ok, now this is an interesting beer.
Fruity hoppy aroma.
Hazy gold color with ample head.
But its all about the taste - the upfront hoppiness is followed by the smooth Sav Blanc background. This shouldnt work but of course it does - a perfect balance of beer and wine.
Of all the beers I have drunk recently, this one truly sticks out as a unique specimen.

Draft at the brewery. Clear bright golden color with a fizzier white head. Aroma is really nice, lots of white grape, stone fruit, slight tropical notes, with some sweet dough. The flavor is quite vinous, lots of sauv blanc, mildly sweet with the tiniest hint of bitterness. Medium-bodied and lively. Quite good and interesting.

[8377-20160529] Tap. White grape grassy hops aroma. Clear, yellow body with a foamy white head. Straw grains and sweet floral hops flavour. Light-medium body cannot hide the alcohol after awhile. Interesting. (7/3/7/4/14) 3.5~
(@ Garage Project 91 Aro, Wellington, NZ)

2016-05-29. Crisp yellow body, small white head. Aroma is very interesting, sort of musky funky grape, may actually be partly coming from something around me - not sure. Notes of grass and lemon. 7+ Flavour is fairly fruity, modest grapes, vinous character, light grassy undertones. Moderate alcohol. Average bodied palate, good carbonation. Tasty. 7/3/7-8/3/15+ On tap at Garage Project - Aro 91, Wellington, NZ.

03.04.2016, 0,65l bottle @ home:
Nice slightly bubbly mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet, grape juice, grass, light malts, hay, sugar, minerals, leafs, hops, citrus. Taste is harsh boozy, weeds, minerals, booze, yeast, grass, harsh hops, grape peel, fruit stones, bark, leafs, grape juice, citrus peel. Medium bitterness, harsh mineraly mouthfeel. Not my cup of tea.
Pours a clear light yellow with a med frothy white head. Aromas of citrus, rye bread, orange peel, honey, green grapes, grass. Taste is very citrusy and grassy with medium carbonation and body.

Bottle. Clear yellow gold, massive white rocky cap. Aroma of funky yeast, grape skin, light lemon/lime citrus juice, wet straw. Taste is sweet, bitter, and slightly salty. Might be my sweat or residual ocean in my moustache. Palate is crisp, effervescent, with a medium-dry finish. 8.5%?! Extremely well balanced.

Bottle 650ml. [ As Garage Project Sauvin Nouveau ].[ Trade by omhper ]. ABV: 8.5%. Clear medium yellow color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, moderate hoppy, pineapple, grape, wine - white wine. Flavor is moderate sweet and moderate to heavy bitter with a long duration, dry, pale malt, hoppy, grapes, tropical fruity - pinmeapple - grapes, grass. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20160109]
Ljus klarglas med mycket skum. Luktar lite grapefrukt. Smakar först grapefrukt sedan lite besk eftersmak.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours clear golden with white head. Quite vinous (white) aroma with green apples, grape juice and light citrus together with some elderflower. Taste is quite pilsnerish with bread, citrus and a light hoppy finish.
Bottle. Frothy White good mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. Moderate malty and light hoppy and light sour aroma. Light biter flavor. Some sour niotes. Average light bitter finish. Creamy palate.

Bottle, 8.5%. Slightly hazy yellow with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, hops, ananas, white wine, grapes and hop. Flavour is malt, fruit, grapes, ananas, white wine, little sweet, fruity, notes of alcohol and medium bitter.
Bottle @ my place. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are fruits, pineapple, malt, grass, hops and has a nice fruity finish.
Bottle @ Saxo tasting. Clear golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, white wine and moderate hoppy - citrus. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 090116

bottle @ home. pours yellow with a large, lasting, frothy white head. Dry, fresh aroma of flowers, grape, bread, subtle spices and wine grape, malt.
Crisp taste with medium body and high (but smooth) carbonation. Flavor is crisp and gently fruity with white grapes, flowers, citrus/oranges, bread, spices. Crisp bitter finish. Considering the 8.5 ABV, its notable but well integrated. Really well balanced.

How: Draught.
Where: BrewDog Kungsholmen, Stockholm.
Appearance: Clear golden colour with a small white head.
Aroma: Malt, grass, some hops, citrus.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Malt, grass, citrus, floral, fruit. Bitter finish.

Flaska från SB. 
Klar gyllengul vätska med vitt skum.
Doftar fint av jordbruk, gröna druvor och grape.
Syrlig frisk smak av vindruvor med en sträv beska. 
En riktig hybrid, finns spår av IPA, Saison och pilsner på samma gång. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Flaska från SB. En torr krispig stor lager med fina fruktiga nyanser. Riktigt snygg Nelson Sauvin-touch. Krus, kiwi, druvor, ananas, passionsfrukt, lime. Snygg krispig munkänsla, bra beska med gräsighet och citrusskal. Riktigt gott.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Golden colour, small white head. Aroma is dry wood, nelson sauvin, quite white wine like notes as well as mild spices. Flavour is quite dry, some white wine meeting tropical fruits and a rather huge bitterness, but all in a nice balance. Surprisingly nice and bitter NSWWish brew (Nelson Sauvin White Wine)...

Bottled 650ml (AIH53, from SB)
Orange color, small white head. Light spicey hops and tropical fruityness in the nose, perhaps a bit white wineous. Medium-bodied. Apple, earthy hops and very white wineous fruity flavor. Finish has some lemony bitterness and orange peels. Yes, really wine meets beer.
@ Basunen: Rätt fruktig med tydlig humle. Inget som handlar om pilsner, mer pa/ipa - gott

Bottle from systembolaget.
Lasting white head. Clear yellow color.
Fine Sauvignon blanc aroma blended with a litle NZ hops.
Huge grape taste and solid bitterness. Medium residual sweetness.

Ganska ljust gul med fast, vit skumkrona. Fräsch fruktig doft med vindruvor, krusbär, tropiska frukter och lite gräs. Smaken är mycket fruktig, lite vindruva, mycket tropisk frukt, lite grästoner och grapebeska. En mycket intressant öl, egentligen en lager men oerhört smakrik.

Bottle at home. Pours a clear pale orange color with a small off-white head. The grapes are present in the aroma along with pale malt, wet hay, nutmeg, grass, peaches and NS-hop (popcorn and diesel). The flavor has more hops and grass, grapefruit and hay. Has a slick and soft mouth feel, full-bodied and medium bitterness. A tasteful and nice beer with lots of the NS-hop. Well-balanced but miss the grapes in the taste.

Flaska från SB. Smak och doft av grapefrukt, citron, krusbär, gröna druvor, vitt vin, gräs med toner av passionfrukt och mango. Frisk, fruktigt, lätt syrlighet, bra balans, beska med smak av grapefrukt och vitt vin. Mycket gott!

650ml bottle. Clear golden with two finger fluffy white head. Aroma of white wine, tropical fruits, grapes, mango, sweet melon and grains, the pilsner base is also clearly noticeable with a sweet and mellow breadiness. Taste is initially fruity white wine and grapes going over to more tropical fruit tones, mango and melon with the wine still present and ending in a sweet breadiness with a light hop bitterness and light wine notes. The mouthfeel is light, the carbonation low and the aftertaste lasting with a nice mix of hop bitterness, grapes and light grape acidity.

Bottled:Pours golden with a slight haze. Low head. Lots of citrus on the nose; lime, oranges and grape fruit. Very bitter taste. Lots of grape fruit. Really long bitterness. Would be wonderful on a hot summer day.

Flaska från SB. Klar och ljusgul i färgen, lågt vitt skum. Frisk syrlig och fruktig doft av en aning maltighet och citrus. Tunn kropp, torr och sträv. Inledande smak av pilsner, går över i beska och tydlig torr, sträv vitvinskaraktär. Lite väl torr och stram a la vitvin för min smak.
Bottle (65 cl) from Systembolaget. Clear golden, medium white head. Bready malt aroma, some white wine notes, pretty harmonic. Medium to full bodied, medium carbonation. Dry, low bitterness.

Bottle from Systembolaget. 

Almost clear golden with a white head. Aroma of grapes, some pineapple and light hay. Similar taste, also with notes of white wine. The body was medium as was the bitterness. A descent one.

Bottle. Pale golde yellow clear. Pale malty, some straw, white grapey, slight green white berryish nose. Med bodied, slight tart, white winey, some citrus. Lots of flavour, wine fruity, some melon, slight green herbyness. This is for a specific occasion. Crayfish party or something where the slight, but fruity, tart and mellow flavour fits in.-- bb
Flaska från SB. Dimmigt gul med vitt skum. Doft av vitt vin. Smaken innehåller även den mycket vin med en del beska från humlen.

Bottled from Systembolaget
Golden with a medium, white head. 
Fruity aroma with apples and grapes. 
Slightly alcoholic with notes of marzipan. 
Fruity flavour with a medium to high bitterness.

Big bottle cons 2015-10-03 web SB, Göteborg
AR: mandarine, pine, white grapes
AP: pale yellow, wee frothy deminishing white head
F: fizzy, white wine, citrus juice, pine,
Beer tasting @ fillepolo 151002. Bottle (650 ml) from Systembolaget. Fruity, malty, grassy and hoppy, sweet, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry, fruity and grassy.
Beer tasting @ fillepolo 2/10-15. Bottle from Systembolaget. Hoppy and fruity with grapefruit and citrus. Body is medium, the finish is dry and fruity with hoppy notes.
Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours a clear golden colour beer with a small head. Fruity and hoppy with notes of citrus. Dry crispy finish

Flaska systembolaget. Dimmig vätska med vitt skum. Fruktig frisk och lätt syrlig doft. Vindruva, grape, citron och skumpa. Örtig smak med mycket grape. Brödig med gräs, citrus och druva. Spritsig kolsyra med ok beska.

650ml bottle from Systembolaget. Clear pale golden, medium size, white head, small lacing. Fresh and fruity aroma, green grapes, gooseberry, green pepper and grassy hops. Medium-bodied, sweet and sliky mouthfeel. The taste is refreshing with green grapes up front, sweet fruits, tropical juices. Floral and grassy hops with a mild bitterness in the finish. Nice one!

Septebmer 29, 2015. Bottle at home. 
Clear pale golden with a small white head. Aroma is white grape skins, goose berries, hints of grain, white pepper, grass and some 
Taste is light sweet, slightly tart and vinous grape skins. Finish is light sweet fruity, dry with grapes, goose berries and grapefruit bitterness. Light to medium bodied, somewhat oily texture, average carbonation. 
Very nice with a prominent vinous character,

Bottle sample at SBWF15. Golden with white head. Aroma is fruity; kiwi, grapes, lemon, grapefruit and passion fruit and faint malt in the background. Taste is crisp and fruity; grape juice, kiwi and passion fruit with a low toned malt character. God I love Nelson

Aroma is kiwi, grapes and a citrusy but yet sweet character. Taste is clean and crisp and you get a first dose from sweet juice from the grapes, gooseberries and kiwi before turning into floral notes and those characteristic Nelson Sauvin hops. A slight herbal undertone. This could be the most interesting interpretation of a pilsener Ive taste for a very long time? Bang on target!
Klar, gul, vitt skum. Doft: Malt, honung, te, äppel källare, vitt vin. Smak: Malt, jäst, äppelmos, trä, apelsin godis, vitt vin, lager, växter, blommigt, inte helt färsk humle.
Pours clear yellow with a finger of white head. Aroma of malt and bread, overripe fruit. Taste is bitter, bready and fairly fruity. Body is light and smooth with average to lively carbonation.

Keg at BrewDog Kungsholmen, Stockholm.  Clear deep golden , small head. Fruity nose with gooseberry and white wine. Sweetish with medium medium body and rounded mouthfeel. Fruity with some caramel, unsurprising flavours of gooseberry and wine. Mid bitter finish.

Draught. Clear golden liquid with medium white head. Aroma of white grapes, grain, white pepper, apples and bread. Taste is dry and light bitter with notes of grapes, pepper, clove and grain. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Nice!

Draught at Brewdog Kungsholmen, Stockholm. Clear golden beer with a decent offwhite head. Fruity hop aroma, grassy, vinous, hay, citrus, floral notes. Hoppy vinous grape flavor, grassy, citrus, hay, floral, herbal notes.

(650ml bottle from Systembolaget) Pours clear medium gold with a smallish white head lingering with lace. Aroma of white grapes and wine, fruity catty Nelson Sauvin hops with grass, flowers and citrus peel, a crisp Pilsner malt base. Flavour is quite fruity initially, semi-sweet with white grape juice, stone fruit, some wine notes, some citrus peel and grassy, floral hop character. Drier in the middle towards the finish, a bit mineral and bitter with resinous citrus peel, herbal vegetation, crackery Pilsner malt and lingering grape notes. Slight alcohol heat. Interesting, good fusion of grape/wine characters with beer though maybe heavier on the former. Nelson hops work well as expected though maybe not super fresh anymore. Good beer, even though I dont adore pilsners that much.
KØLF 060315. Golden colour with a white head. Flavour is grapes, malt, yeast, grapefruit, pine, fruit, citrus, floral. Nice beer.

Bottle at Øltorget, november 14th 2014. Semiclear golden body, big white head. Aroma of crisp malt, mild peppers, and that delicious tropical/cat pee Nelson hop. Dry zesty body, a bit thin, good bitterness, with a fruity and refreshing finish. Quite good.

Bomber. Thanks, wombata. Nice fat Nelson nose. Very thin pale straw color. Nelson and pale malty initial, small stone fruit and citrus notes, mild bittering in mid palate. Melds into a squeeze of peaches and Nelson. Dont quite get the grape bit. Thin-medium body. Very pleasant, thin flavors.

Bottled. Nose is huge catpiss Nelson hops, grapes. PAle-medium gold, hazy, wiht lace. Huge Sauvignon grape flavor, a bit of sweet grape sugar remaining, crackers, grapefruity hops, dry finish. Nice stuff.

From Crafty Cow (bought with our voucher). Hazy translucent green-fold, yeasty white hear, foamy streaky legs. Smells of grape, white wine, sweet honey malt/corn. Tastes less sweet than the aroma, dry frothy hop, toasty corn-y malt, very dry wine, very light pepper. Body is bitter, mineral-y, slick, medium-to-thick. Interesting beer. White wine is quite evident, esp. in the aroma.

(Expensive!) bottle from Crafty Cow at home. Clear light peach-gold pour. Minimal head. Somewhat weak aroma but interesting. Pilsener woodsiness with sweet grape. Taste is similar - good depth of unusual flavor. Pale lager bitterness to start, quite sharp and bitter, which transitions into bitter dry grape flavor of a white wine. Dry dry finish. Really good combination of wine and beer flavors, while remaining squarely a solid pale lager. Would get again but not for HK$258.
Fresh wort, sauvin hops, tropical fruits, heady very rich very differeent. Medium full body. Smooth non-boozy rounded. Unique. Fantasric

650 ml bottle. Clear golden body with a big, fluffy white head. Very nice aroma of grapes, mild grape fruit and flowers. Nice and refreshing flavor of light pale malt, citric fruit, grapes, white vine and quite bitter. Fine balanced body and pleasant aftertaste. Slightly unusually but it really works for me.

Bottle. Pours clear golden with a tiny off-white head. Aroma of grapes, grapefruit, citrus, some floral notes, kiwi and malt. Flavor is sweet and fruity with some grapes, white wine, citrus and malt. Medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle. Pours a clear golden body with a small white head. Nose is muscat grapes, grape peel, straw, hints of red fruits, wet grass and mild yeasty tones. Taste is grape peel, muscat grape juice, bitter herbs, grass, tomato plant and hints of pine with an almost medicinal bitterness towards the end. Light body, dry finish, medium carbonation. Quite refreshing, though a bit too much on the bitter side for me, since both the fermented grapes and generous Nelson hops contribute to the mix. Decent and rather innovative, though.
Bottle. Pours a hazy yellow color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty peachy hoppy aroma. Fruity malty peachy hoppy flavor. Has a fruity malty peachy hoppy finish.

650 ml bottle. Label says 8.5% abv, not 7.6% as listed here. Crystal clear golden. Tall fine white head that clings to the glass. Grape aromas and Nelson Sauvin hops. Very aromatic and it works really well. Vital and lively. Nice malty flavours and a gentle crisp hoppy bitterness. Well balanced beer with a delicate fruity flavour.
A mildly grainy profile with hop notes and grapes underneath. I enjoyed this one more than the other grape brew they put on. Could have a glass of this one.
Litt uklar gul farge med hvitt luftig skum. Lukter gjær. Litt vinøs. Litt syrlig i smak. Tørr og bitter avslutning.

UPDATED: JUN 28, 2015 Gulbrun klar med lavt hvitt skum. Lett fruktig sydhavsfrukt, ananas, fersken og noe blomsteraktig lukt. Søt smak, sydhavsfrukt. Syrlig druesten og eplesmak. Litt floralsk smak også. Tørr. Kort, syrlig, bitter ettersmak.

How: Bottle. Appearance: Yellow, almost olden color, clear with a small white head. Aroma: Tropical fruits, grapes, grass Taste: Nice balance between bitterness and sweetness. Palate: Medium body, lively carbonation, soft bitter finish.

Clear golden with white head. Aroma is white wine, citrus, minerals and some grapefruit. Rich and fruity palate. Aftertaste is dry, white wine, citric, minerals, floral notes and some spice. Overall: Probably the most interesting beer ive tried this year. Well done!

Big white head. Clear coppery body. Fruity resiny aroma with
grapefruit notes. Dry resiny grapefruit taste with spicy herbal grape
notes. Mid-bodied. Mild, soft mouthfeel. Dryish resiny gooseberry
and grapefruit aftertaste with pineapple, spice, and grape notes. Very
nice, and quite unusual. (0.75l bottle, from wine monopoly Oslo
City.)

65cl bottle shared by Arve_Christian - thanks a lot! Pours clear golden with a white head. Surprisingly vinous aroma of white wine grapes, some herbal notes, mild grassy and malty with hints of sour fruits. Surprisingly grape dominated flavour, but well balanced and with a nice acidity and bitterness. Tasty one!

On bottle from Vinmonopolet Hasle. Clear golden color,ok foam. Medium aroma intensity; very fruity, distinct grape ( the Sauvignon Blanc), some citrus. Medium body & complexity. SOme bitterness, balances very well. Very enjoyable- but of course Sauvignon Blanc is my favorite white wine grape

Bottle from Vika enjoyed at home
Pours golden clear with a creamy white head. Smell of sauvignon blanc grapes, fruity white wine aromas, spicy hops, light malts. Very refreshing. Moderate sweet, sauvignon grapes, some hints of acids, quite fruity, hints of spices and herbs, light malts, hints of grass. Moderate to medium bitter finish, some nice grassy and herbal tendensies. This beer sure is a blast. What a good idea to mix a nelson sauvin pilsener with the actual sauvignon grapes! It gets the best of two worlds. Should be a winner in the summer; and probably very good with sea food. Recommended
Bottle 65cl. Foamy big white head. Not too carbonated, a bit hazy. Aroma is hops, honey, flowers, nettles. Taste is surprisingely sweet of honey and butter.

UPDATED: OCT 16, 2016 Okay so I dont like lager but... Typical of GP, this a high quality brew and a fine drink - not at all cloying - a rich, fuller bodied, more complex and tasty pilsner with its own character. Very Sauv Blanc-ish.
Pale gold with fluffy white head. Maltiness (roasty) and grassy aromas dominate, some residual sweetness with some warming barleywinish flavours and feelz. Nice.

Bouteille de 650 ml partagée lors dune dégustation entre amis. Arôme: Légère odeur de fruits tropicaux. Apparence: La couleur est blonde. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune large dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de fruits tropicaux avec une pointe dagrumes. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Légère présence de citron en arrière goût. (Rating #5828)

Enjoyed at the 2014 Firestone Walker Invitational. It looks and smells like a pils, with a clear golden hue and peppery Czech hop aroma, but thats where similarities end. Wine grapes permeate the flavor, though the bitter hops and pale malt lend a snappy pilsner finish. Very tasty, very drinkable.
Very nice crisp, fresh beverage. Fresh clean flavours with plenty of punch. Very well balanced. Big fruity grape fruit, feels almost oily on the palate after a sip. Very clean.
Nice aromatic Pilsner, with passion fruit and jack fruit on the aroma and a cider-like taint on the flavour. Finish is dry. Pleasant, but not memorable.
Pours a clear yellow with a white head. Aroma is malt, fruit; particularly passionfruit, yeast, cruits and wine. Taste is medium sweet leading to a nice dry finish. Very impressed by this one!

Golden colour with a 1 finger white head. Sauvignon blanc notes are immediately apparent, along with citrus and pine. Lots of pine upfront with a little sweetness, then the vinous Sauvignon blanc, finishing very dry. Light bodied. Im quite enjoying this unique beer.

Looks.. Translucent yellow/golden w/- sml white head.
Smells..vinous, grassy, citrus and some tropical fruits.
Tastes.. Super grassy and sauv blanc, tropical fruits, finishing dry with a lingering tasty pilsner malt. This is sensational.
Kinda dank aroma. Bright golden colour. Crisp falvours of nectarine and pear. Very smooth. Not the typical nelson sauvon hops I have tasted.

Tap at FWIBF. Pours a clear yellow with big white head. Aroma is white wine, tannin, hay, barley chaff and some sweet fruit. Taste is very white wine forward and dry. Some sweet grape and then a harsh oak presence. Nice overall for a white wine/beer.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: UPDATED: FEB 15, 2016 A brilliant beer that combines the crisp clean taste of a pilsner on the grain side with the similarly crisp clean taste of a Sav-blanc on the grape side. A different brew that ticks most of my aroma/taste boxes.

Bottle from Beervana 2013. Pale yellow-straw, fine white head, very fruity aroma, passionfruit, grape juice, apple, amazing fruity flavours, sweet but with a really well balanced bitterness, delicate and light but dry grassy bitterness, residual sweetness, light body, slightly sticky texture. Amazingly complex, very nice.

For a not bitter beer this certainly has a bang of hops in it, no mistaking the grassy notes, but theyre a little magical in the delivery, this is altogether a bit clever. It carries a long soft bitter note but has a wonderfully moorish over-riding sweetness. Im lost to describe just how soft and welcome on the palate this is, its really good and youll kick yourself for missing it.

Look is a pils heaven. Aroma is nelson sauvin hops galore! Taste is tangy bitterness with hoppy pils tang. Pretty intense and complex, but not to my palate. Overall, another interesting and drinkable brew from Garage Project.

Bottle from mane liquor. Pours a light straw yellow with no head. Nose is full of sav blanc!! Citric and grassy hop driven. Taste is more of the fruits - passionfruit, citrus, lychee. Light on the palate very thin mouth feel. Soft/medium carbonation. Half wine half beer basically best way to some it up. Hoppy white wine. Good stuff

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Mane Liquor. Wow, great start to the night. Pours vibrant orange with a small, firm white head. Nose resembles a Sauv Blanc! Very grassy and citric. Taste is veryfruit driven - passionfruit, citrus, pineapple, lychee. Very in your face fruit driven and bright. Grassy like a dry Sauv Blanc. Half wine, half beer and a damn good one at that

Pours gold with a fading head.
Nose shows potent Nelson passion fruit notes along with some cookie dough characters. Interesting stuff.
Similar flavours, big Nelson hop characters. Not much malt but there is a faint fruity sweetness. Finishes very dry and bitter. Almost sharp.
Carbonation could be a little higher.

Bottle from Slowbeer. Pours golden yellow with a light, fluffy white head. Immediate pungent tropical fruit aromas - mango, passionfruit, kiwifruit with a hit of buttery resin. A light floral malt profile backed by a big white grape acidic sweet aroma. Taste is really smooth. Crisp floral and tropical notes carried by huge sauv blanc grape flavours, once again with sweet acidity. The wine hit isnt too sharp, but really adds some complexity to what tastes like a fucking good pilsner. Awesome beer.
Incredibly interesting beer here. Has very much a wine characteristic, and yet its a pilsner, crazy,
I am with dylansdad, this was awesome, Huge flavours and really well balanced, a really well made beer: nice work garage project.

UPDATED: AUG 28, 2013 ReRate after drinking 3rd bottle (oh, lucky me): Dunno whether its because I have a cleaner palate this time or whether this bottle is a bit long in the tooth, but the grape notes are a lot more to the fore this time, and the rich pilly notes of the first and second bottle are a bit more back seat. Slight spiciness and woodiness at the finish. Im actually sticking my little finger out as I drink this; I feel so, er, refined or sumsuch. Original Post: Look, Im not a polite fellow, and I normally only drink wine to be polite, so I know next to nothing about wine. Imagine my slight lack of enthusiasm when I cracked this "wine-beer" and sucked the smoke into my nostrils. First up, a hit of floral and fruity hops. Immediately subsumed by classic pilsner notes. I picked out some grape notes sneaking out through the pilsner, but as soon as I noticed them they would disappear, in a flash, into the malt pillow. Taste, at first, was like the aroma: a delicious, perfectly balanced pilsener with something fattening up the middle and a sharp, puckery aftertaste. Thats where I could really pick out the grape notes. Then, as the beer warmed and my palate adjusted, it all melded into one awesome pilsner. Its not a wine, its a beer. It held its flavour for as long as it took me to drink the bottle. Not only one of the best pilsners Ive ever had, but one of the best beers. Amen.

A wine made like a beer? A beer made with wine? Whatever. Its interesting; sharp and bitter - the cat piss on a gooseberry bush characteristic of sav blanc is right there, front and centre, but the sweetness and funkiness of the beer side of this brew comes through strongly, ending almost in a Belgian fashion. Interesting.

2013 vintage (which was a great wine vintage in NZ). Predominately pilsner on the nose with subtle grassy sauvignon blanc undertones. Pours very clean with little head. On the palate the sauv come through a bit more with a bit of acidity. Once again a nicely presented package and hopefully they make this again as I question adding beers when in reality they will not get to ten ratings due to the very small production run.
